intro: Psychotria eggersii, commonly known as the "Soul of the Forest," is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It often grows in shaded, humid environments and is frequently found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Psychotria eggersii is also known for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its uses remain largely undocumented.
